Coming from a poor, working-class background, Helena Kennedy feels particularly strongly about education as it was such a pivotal force in her own life. Learning shouldn't be a commodity. It changed me: I learned about the other, about how the world worked, about art and music. Education will continue to be available to the privileged, but will it be for someone from a background like mine?
